newsitem.title: PERU: Ecuador's President Bucaram visits Peru.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's President Bucaram visits Peru.

text.p: Ecuadorean President Abdala Bucaram arrived in Peru on Monday for an official visit aimed at easing tensions between the countries following a brief border conflict last year.

It was the first official bilateral visit to Peru by an Ecuadorean head of state. During Bucaram's three-day stay, Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori will try to show that business goes on as usual despite a 27-day-old hostage crisis.
Fujimori met Bucaram at Lima's military airport and the two left amid tight security without any comment to reporters.

The two Andean neighbours fought a brief war in January last year in which dozens were killed and hundreds injured on both sides. Since then they have been locked in peace negotiations over the disputed frontier.

Marxist rebels holding 74 hostages at the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima were quick to respond to Bucaram's arrival, putting up a placard at a window of the house reading: "The people of Peru and Ecuador wish for peace with social justice".
